Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; de; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Ubuntu/10.10 (maverick) Firefox/3.6.15

When opening a new window in javascript, and later calling the window's .focus() method, the window gets focused. When doing the same with tabs, this does not work. The focus stays on the current window.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the attached file
2. Click on the text "click here for opening in new tab"
3. The new tab opens
4. Go back to the first tab
5. Click on the text "click here for opening in new tab" again


click here for opening in new window
click here for opening in new tab
Actual Results:  
In step 5, the current tab stays focused.

Expected Results:  
The tab opened in step 2 should get focused again.

Successfully reproduced on FF3.6 and FF4.0. Works as expected in Google Chrome.
